Classes

Files

Settings

Provides abilities to

  • Parse and write settings from/to a file
  • Store and retrieve values depending on key and section
  • Define default values for a key
  • Fill missing values with defaults
  • Replace all values with defaults
Summary
Settings
Functions
Settings
parse
Parses the settings file
defaults
Method to either fill missing values or to replace all values with defaults
write
Writes settings to the file
setDefault
Defines a default string value for a key in section “GENERAL”

Defines a default string value for a key in a section
setDefault
Defines a default integer value for a key in section “GENERAL”

Defines a default integer value for a key in a section

Returns string value of a key in section “GENERAL”

getColorValue
Returns a color of key in a section
setDefaultColor
Same as setDefault for integers or strings but required a different name due to the difference analogy of FXColor=FXuint to FXint
setDefaultColor
Same as setDefault for integers or strings but required a different name due to the difference analogy of FXColor=FXuint to FXint

Settings(const FXString &filename)

Parameters

filenameFile to parse from and write to

parse

void parse()

Parses the settings file

  • Creates settings file if it doesn’t already exist and writes default values to it
  • Parses the settings file
  • Fills missing values with defaults

Method to either fill missing values or to replace all values with defaults

replaceReplace existing values

setDefaultColor

void setDefaultColor(const FXString &key,
 FXColor value)

Same as setDefault for integers or strings but required a different name due to the difference analogy of FXColor=FXuint to FXint

setDefaultColor

void setDefaultColor(const FXString &section,
const FXString &key,
 FXColor value)

Same as setDefault for integers or strings but required a different name due to the difference analogy of FXColor=FXuint to FXint
